#Text=Loei
#Text=Loei ( เลย ) is a city in the Isaan region of Thailand .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Loei is a city surrounded by undulating mountain ranges whose fog-shrouded summits are abundant with flora .
#Text=The well-known mountains are Phu Kradung , Phu Luang , and Phu Ruea .
#Text=Its temperature is comfortably cool , with beautiful geographical surroundings , as well as unique cultures and traditions .
#Text=In the cool season it can get decidedly chilly , one of the few parts of Thailand that ever gets down to 0 degrees Celsius .
#Text=Loei is 520 km from Bangkok , covering an area of 11,424 square kilometres .
#Text=The city 's population is roughly 23,000 .
#Text=It is a boundary ( with Laos ) province in the upper northeastern part of Thailand , on the bank of the Mekong River along the Phetchabun mountain range .
#Text=In the past , it was a small community in a prosperous empire during the same period as the Thai Kingdom of Ayutthaya .
#Text=Later , the Lan Chang Empire became weaker , therefore , the community moved to be with Ayutthaya .
#Text=During the reign of King Rama V of the Rattanakosin period , the community was upgraded to become Loei Province .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Bangkok , take Hwy 1 or Phahonyothin Rd , passing Saraburi .
#Text=Turn onto Hwy 21 , passing Phetchabun .
#Text=Then , take Hwy 203 , passing Lom Sak , Lom Kao into Loei Province at Dan Sai , Phu Ruea to Loei .
#Text=It takes approximately 7-8 hours .

#Text=Alternately , from Saraburi , take Hwy 2 , passing Nakhon Ratchasima to Khon Kaen , for a distance of 536 km and turn left onto Hwy 12 , passing Chum Phae and take Hwy 201 to Loei Province through Phu Kradueng , and Wang Saphung , a distance of 540 km .
#Text=From Bangkok
#Text=The Transport Co. , Ltd. provides daily buses between Bangkok – Loei , both normal and air conditioned .
#Text=The trip takes approximately 10 hours .
#Text=For further information , contact the Bangkok Northern Bus Terminal ( Mo Chit 2 ) , Kamphaeng Phet 2 Rd , Tel . +66 2 9362841-8 , +66 2 9362852-66.

#Text=There are private bus companies such as Air Mueang Loei Co. , Ltd. ' s Bangkok office at Tel . +66 2 9360142 or Loei Office at Tel . +66 42 832042 ; Chumpae Tour Ltd. , Bangkok office at Tel . +66 2 9363842 or Loei office at Tel . +66 42 832285 ; Phet Prasoet Co. , Ltd. ' s Bangkok office at Tel . +66 2 9363230 , Phu Ruea office at Tel . +66 42 899386 , Dan Sai office at Tel . +66 42 891908 .
#Text=From Phitsanulok
#Text=Many buses are available from Phitsanulok , which is a particularly convenient starting point for exploring the area west of Loei ( Dan Sai , etc. ) .
#Text=There are two bus terminals in Phitsanulok .
#Text=No.1 which is very accessible by foot and no.2 which is like 5 km away from the city on the highway 12 on Indochina junctions .
#Text=50 baht to get there on a songtheaw .
#Text=Both terminals have the exact same time for the busses going to loei .
#Text=So just stick to terminal no.1 .
#Text=Time schedule for busses to loei are 9:30 and 12:00 .
#Text=Arrive earlier so you can catch the early bus , otherwise it 's all booked pretty fast .
#Text=Price as of 2017 , goes for 207 baht .
#Text=Within Isaan
#Text=There are regular buses to Loei from Khon Kaen ( buses every 30 min ) and Udon Thani ( 100 baht ) .
#Text=Buses depart from bus station 2 , somewhat inconveniently outside the main town .
#Text=By train
#Text=There is no railway station in Loei .
#Text=However , visitors can take a train from Bangkok Railway Station ( Hualamphong ) to Udon Thani or Phitsanulok , and take a bus to Loei .
#Text=By plane
#Text=There are 2-3 flights weekly from Bangkok on Nok Air , one of Thailand 's domestic discount airlines to Loei Airport ( LOE ) .
#Text=Service has changed from time to time .

#Text=If it is not available , the next-nearest airport with commercial flights is Udon Thani with flights to/from Bangkok , Chiang Mai , and Phuket using Thai Airways , Nok Air , and Air Asia ( Thailand ) .
#Text=As noted above , there are frequent buses from Udon to Loei .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Songthaews can be used to reach the town from the bus station ( 10 baht ) .
#Text=Tuk-tuks are also available to and around town .
#Text=Local buses and/or songthaews serve some of the noteworthy sights mentioned below .
#Text=See
#Text=Most interesting tourist attractions are sufficiently far away they require public transport or a motorbike to reach them .
#Text=Chaopho Kut Pong Shrine and the City Pillar Shrine ( ศาลเจ้าพ่อกุดป่องและศาลหลักเมือง )

column3: ศาลเจ้าพ่อกุดป่องและศาลหลักเมือง

column1: #Text=The city pillar was made of the golden shower wood elaborately carved into a lotus shape at its top and gilded with gold leaf on black lacquer .
#Text=Its height is .
#Text=Chaloem Phra Kiat Public Park , Pa Loeng Yai ( สวนสาธารณะเฉลิมพระเกียรติฯ ป่าเลิงใหญ่ ) A public park on the Loei River .

column3: สวนสาธารณะเฉลิมพระเกียรติฯ
ป่าเลิงใหญ่

column1: #Text=There is a decorative garden with flowers and decorative plants .
#Text=Office of the Loei Tourism Coordination Centre ( อาคารที่ทำการศูนย์ประสานงานการท่องเที่ยวจังหวัดเลย ) Previously the city hall and Mueang Loei District office .

column3: อาคารที่ทำการศูนย์ประสานงานการท่องเที่ยวจังหวัดเลย

column1: #Text=The Loei Provincial Council of Culture collected the king 's chair at this place .
#Text=The Fine Arts Department has registered it as a national monument for preservation .
#Text=Wat Tham Pha Pu or Phiang Din cave ( วัดถ้ำผาปู่ หรือ ถ้ำเพียงดิน ) , Houses the remains of Luangpu Khamdi Paphaso , who discovered this place .

column3: วัดถ้ำผาปู่
ถ้ำเพียงดิน

column1: #Text=The temple is a grand cave within a stone mountain .
#Text=There are Buddha images enshrined in the cave , as well as stalagmites and stalactites .
#Text=Phu Pha Lom Forest Park ( วนอุทยานภูผาล้อม )

column3: วนอุทยานภูผาล้อม

column1: #Text=Steep limestone mountains with various pointed summits similar to a wall surrounding the virgin forest in the middle .
#Text=There are various kinds of plants , herbs , sightseeing points , and caves as well as , Bo Nam Sap or Nam Phut , which is a sacred seepage pond .
#Text=Si Khun Mueang temple ( วัดศรีคุณเมือง )

column3: วัดศรีคุณเมือง

column1: #Text=This temple is a collection venue of Lanna and Lan Chang arts .
#Text=The ubosot 's roof is in many layers reflecting Lanna-style .
#Text=There are also many objects of art such as a carved Buddha image gilded with gold leaf on black lacquer in the forgiving posture of the Lan Chang style .
#Text=Phu Khwai Ngoen
#Text=Buddha 's footprint ( พระพุทธบาทภูควายเงิน )

column3: พระพุทธบาทภูควายเงิน

column1: #Text=The Buddha 's footprint is 120 centimetres long and 65 centimetres wide , enshrined on a whetstone and was registered as a national ancient monument in 1935 .
#Text=Phu Khok Ngio Buddha statue ( พระใหญ่ภูคกงิ้ว )

column3: พระใหญ่ภูคกงิ้ว

column1: #Text=A walking Buddha image in the blessing posture , cast of fibre and golden resin combined .
#Text=It was cast by the Second Army Area Command and the people as a form of merit making for the king and queen .
#Text=Thai Dam Cultural Village ( หมู่บ้านวัฒนธรรมไทยดำ )

column3: หมู่บ้านวัฒนธรรมไทยดำ

column1: #Text=Thai Dam people migrated from Chiang Khwang Town , Laos in 1905 to settle at Ban Na Pa Nat .
#Text=At present , the Thai Dam culture is still preserved .
#Text=Crown Princess 's Sirindhorn Art Centre ( ศูนย์ศิลป์สิรินธร ) A venue displaying paintings of students who have gained popularity at both national and international levels .

column3: ศูนย์ศิลป์สิรินธร

column1: #Text=Moreover , it is a source of knowledge on arts and culture , including both permanent and rotating exhibition halls , and an arts training building .
#Text=Phu Luang Wildlife Sanctuary ( เขตรักษาพันธุ์สัตว์ป่าภูหลวง )

column3: เขตรักษาพันธุ์สัตว์ป่าภูหลวง

column1: #Text=Phu Luang means ' large mountain ' or the ' mountain of the king ' .
#Text=On the east of Phu Luang , dinosaur footprints on the rock , aged more than 120 million years , were discovered .
#Text=The most distinguished ones on Phu Luang are Pinus merkusii and Kesiya pine forests , savanna on plains , mounds , and stone terraces .
#Text=Pha Ya cave ( ถ้ำผายา ) is inside Wat Tham Pha Ya at Ban Mai Santi Tham , Tambon Na Dok Kham .
#Text=Inside the cave is a flock of millions of insect-eating bats .
#Text=Suan Hin Pha Ngam or Thailand 's Kunming ( สวนหินผางาม หรือ คุนหมิงเมืองไทย ) A limestone garden aged around 230-280 million years , occurring from the aggregation of beach deposits .

column3: สวนหินผางาม
คุนหมิงเมืองไทย

column1: #Text=Then , an uplift of the earth 's crust , together with millions of years of natural rot have made this mountain strangely beautiful , similar to the stone garden in Kunming , Yunnan , China .
#Text=Mahoran Cave ( ถ้ำมโหฬาร )
#Text=A large cave whose entrance enshrines a Buddha image in subduing Mara posture .
#Text=The area within the cave is quite large consisting of stalactites and stalagmites , as well as , caves in smaller sizes .
#Text=A Buddha 's footprint was also found on the wall of the cave .
#Text=Phothisat Cave ( ถ้ำโพธิสัตว์ ) or Thailand 's Guilin is within the compound of Wat Tham Phothisat .

column3: ถ้ำโพธิสัตว์

column1: #Text=It is a complex cave .
#Text=Piang Din Waterfall ( น้ำตกเพียงดิน ) is beyond Suan Hin Pha Ngam .

column3: น้ำตกเพียงดิน

column1: #Text=The waterfall is at the end of the asphalt road .
#Text=Phrathat Si Song Rak ( พระธาตุศรีสองรัก )

column3: พระธาตุศรีสองรัก

column1: #Text=Its architecture is in the Lan Chang style .
#Text=Phrathat , a stupa containing the Buddha 's relics , is 19.19 metres high and 10.89 metres wide with a square base of 12 redented corners .
#Text=Moreover , within the compound of the temple is enshrined a Buddha image canopied by a seven-headed Naga in the Tibetan-style .
#Text=Neramit Wipatsana temple ( วัดเนรมิตวิปัสสนา )

column3: วัดเนรมิตวิปัสสนา

column1: #Text=Both the ubosot and chedi are constructed of laterite .
#Text=A replica of Phra Phutthachinnarat is enshrined as the main image .
#Text=Phi Ta Khon Museum ( พิพิธภัณฑ์บ้านผีตาโขน )

column3: พิพิธภัณฑ์บ้านผีตาโขน

column1: #Text=An educational attraction for those interested in the Bun Luang and Phi Ta Khon Festivals .
#Text=There is an ubosot reflecting the skills of local craftsmen as well as a replica of Phrathat Si Song Rak .
#Text=Pho Chai Na Phueng temple ( วัดโพธิ์ชัยนาพึง )

column3: วัดโพธิ์ชัยนาพึง

column1: #Text=Enshrined within the abbot 's cell is the Prachao Ong Saen Buddha image , an ancient image of the town for many generations .
#Text=On the outside of the ubosot are paintings which were created in 1916 .
#Text=The Thai-Lao Friendship Bridge ( สะพานมิตรภาพน้ำเหืองไทย-ลาว )

column3: สะพานมิตรภาพน้ำเหืองไทย-ลาว

column1: #Text=A bridge crossing the Hueang River connecting Thailand and Laos .
#Text=Cotton Blossom Festival .
#Text=Every year , in early-February .
#Text=Phitakon ( ผีตาโขน , Phi Ta Kon , Phi Ta Khon ) ( Dan Sai is about 2 hours W of Loei .
#Text=It can be reached by bus ) .
#Text=The best worst-publicised festival in Thailand .
#Text=Every year in Dan Sai ( ด่านซ้าย ) the Phi Ta Kon festival is held .
#Text=Revellers make traditional masks , which they wear in a parade down the main street of Dan Sai .

#Text=Traditionally , the masks were made to frighten evil spirits away , the wearer dons the mask and drags bells behind them with the intention of clearing the surrounding area of evil spirits ( generally while drinking large amounts of home brewed spirits of a different kind ) .

#Text=Afterward , the parade begins and thousands of people head through the streets for what becomes a chaotic fertility festival , many participants in the parade carry phallic water guns and comically over-sized wooden penises with them .

#Text=Phu Kradueng National Park ( อุทยานแห่งชาติภูกระดึง ) , Moo 1 , Ban Si Than , Si Than Sub-district , Phu Kradung District ( Hwy 2019 leads to the park ) , ☏ +6642810833 , ✉ phukradueng_np@dnp.go.th .

column3: อุทยานแห่งชาติภูกระดึง

column1: #Text=A sandstone mountain park with a wide plain summit , whose shape is similar to a leaf of the elephant ear or a heart .
#Text=Sites in the park :
#Text=Nok Aen cliff : A small stone terrace with pine trees standing at the cliff 's edge .
#Text=It is a beautiful sunrise spot overlooking the scenery of the grass field and mountain range ; Lom Sak cliff : A wide stone terrace with a large pine tree near an overhanging cliff .
#Text=It is a place where the sunset can be the most clearly viewed ;
#Text=Tat Hong waterfall : When falling from the cliff to the basin , it creates a loud and resonant sound of water .
#Text=Therefore , it is called " Namtok Tat Hong " .
#Text=Phu Ruea National Park ( อุทยานแห่งชาติภูเรือ ) , Nong Bou Sub-district , Phu Rua District ( The park is 48 km from Loei .

column3: อุทยานแห่งชาติภูเรือ

column1: #Text=Take Hwy 203 to Phu Ruea Sub-District then turn right and go about 4 km to park HQ ) , ☏ +66885095299 , ✉ phurua1@hotmail.com .
#Text=Its special feature is an overhanging cliff in the shape of a junk 's prow .
#Text=It is considered the coldest national park of the country .
#Text=Interesting sites :

#Text=Decho Viewpoint : sunrise view spot ; Lon Noi cliff : From this spot , Phu Luang , Phu Pha Sat , Phu Khrang and a sea of complex mountain ranges can be seen ; Sapthong or Kulap cliff : A steep cliff with seepage full of water throughout the year where there is plenty of golden yellow lichen ;
#Text=Huai Phai waterfall : This waterfall is drops from a steep cliff with an approximate height of 30 metres ;

#Text=Phu Ruea peak : The highest spot in the national park at 1,365 m. Within its compound is a stone terrace and grass field mixed with pine forest including Pinus merkusii which is naturally grown and Kesiya pine which is planted .

#Text=Phu Suan Sai National Park ( อุทยานแห่งชาติภูสวนทราย ) , Saeng Pha Sub-district , Na Haeo District ( From Loei , take Hwy 2003 , 2031 , and 2113 to Na Haeo District and then about 4 km further to Ban Mueng Prea .

column3: อุทยานแห่งชาติภูสวนทราย

column1: #Text=Turn left on Hwy 1268 and turn right at its last junction at the km0 kilometre post .
#Text=From km0 it is just a few meters to park HQ ) .
#Text=Dry evergreen forests mixed with deciduous trees .
#Text=Along the high area are hill evergreen forests which are also a natural boundary between Thailand and Laos .
#Text=Interesting sites :
#Text=Khing waterfall : The waterfall has many rock tiers .

#Text=At this spot , the government has constructed a royal residence for Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn who visited on 12 February 1991 ; Chang Tok waterfall : 500 m higher than Namtok Khing which is also along the Phrae River .
#Text=It is steeper than the lower one ;

#Text=Wang Tat waterfall : 1.5 kilometres above Namtok Chang Tok on the Phrae River ; Tat Hueang or Thai-Lao waterfall is on the Hueang River , consisting of three tiers with a height of approximately 50 metres .
#Text=There is water throughout the year ; Pha Khao waterfall : On the Heuang River , the border between Thailand and Laos . ;
#Text=Four direction rock : On its south side are four rocks rising up in the middle of the tropical evergreen forest .

#Text=Local people go to pay respect at this place once every three years , thus it is called " Song Pi Ham , Sam Pi Khrop " ; Kuai Lo rock : A sandstone whose shape is similar to a mushroom bud rising in the middle of the tropical evergreen forest ;
#Text=Hill 1408 Viewpoint : The highest viewpoint and centre of the national park ; Hill 1255 Viewpoint : The scenery of Ban Huai Nam Phak below as well as Phu Soi Dao and Phu Wiang in Laos .
